oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Superconductivity at 12-K IN Y-NI-B system
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAZUMDAR, C
NAGARAJAN, R
GODART, C
GUPTA, LC
LATROCHE, M
DHAR, SK
LEVYCLEMENT, C
PADALIA, BD
VIJAYARAGHAVAN, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sharp drop in resistivity and diamagnetic susceptibility below 12 K clearly indicate a superconducting (SC) transition in the system Y-Ni-B (nominal composition: YNi4B). Possibility of a magnetic phase transition at this temperature is ruled out by our specific heat measurements. Superconducting fraction of our samples, as estimated from Meissner effect measurements, is about 2%.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics,EUGENE, OR,AUG 04-11, 1993
